cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly WNW across the eastern-central Caribbean, forecast to slow and turn NW near Jamaica/Cuba this weekend, then curve toward the Florida peninsula and southeastern U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast (near or north of Tampa Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Florida at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect for Florida at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South Florida coast including Florida Keys, entire Florida peninsula, and eventually Georgia/South Carolina coasts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible late Monday night into Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Atlantic surge minimal; any rise expected to remain below 2 ft along the Broward County coastline
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could produce 2–4 inches with isolated higher amounts exceeding 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands, dangerous rip currents and rough seas for pilot/berthing operations
